entry.title: Meyers Fire Update September 2, 2017
entry.summary: Current Size: 30,486 acresResources Assigned: 322 Extreme fire conditions. No campfires allowed. Status: The fire is burning in mixed conifer stands, primarily lodgepole pine, Douglas fir, and subalpine fir, with numerous standing dead trees. There are residences still at risk in the Moose Lake, Frog Pond, Springer Memorial Park and Bonanza areas. Yesterday’s Activities: Fire activity was not as intense as on Thursday, but the periphery did continue to expand in several areas with some short-range spotting, torching and fire runs occurring. The eastern edge of the fire south of Moose Lake advanced beyond the Continental Divide Trail into Deer Lodge County, with some additional spotting ahead of the fire. The Moose Lake and East Fork Bitterroot communities remain in a pre-evacuation warning status. Along the fire’s west edge, ground crews made progress on control lines and burn outs, and continued structure protection measures in the Frog Pond and East Fork...

entry.title: Meyers Fire Update for September 1, 2017
entry.summary: There is a public meeting tonight at 6:00PM at the Sula Community Clubhouse in Sula.Current Size: 28,914 acres Resources Assigned: 292 Status: The fire is burning in mixed conifer stands, primarily lodgepole pine, with many standing dead trees. There are residences at risk in the vicinity of the fire in the areas of Moose Lake, Frog Pond, Springer Memorial Park and Bonanza. Yesterday’s Activities: Significant fire activity occurred yesterday as a result of dry, hot conditions and tinder-dry fuels responding to gusty, erratic winds. The eastern edge of the fire south of Moose Lake extended well beyond the primary containment line. The slop over caused a temporary closure of the Moose Lake Rd while officials re-assessed the threat to the Moose Lake community which remains, for the moment, in a pre-evacuation warning status. Slower rates of fire towards the Springer Memorial and Bonanza areas has allowed firefighters to identify and implement structure protection...

entry.title: Meyers Fire Community Meetings
entry.summary: The Northern Rockies Type 2 Incident Management Team is hosting a public meeting on the Meyers Fire. A meeting will be held on Friday, September 1 at 6:00 pm at the Sula Community Club House on East Fork Road in Sula for the Meyers Fire.
